current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To promote unlicensed spectrum use in the 5 GHz band, to maximize the use of the band for shared
			 purposes in order to bolster innovation and economic development, and for
			 other purposes.

header.#text: Technical rules suitable for the widespread commercial development of unlicensed operations

term.#tail: means technical rules that, to the maximum extent feasible—
term.#text: technical rules suitable for the widespread commercial development of unlicensed operations

text.#text: The term
permit outdoor unlicensed operations;

permit unlicensed operations at a maximum conducted transmitter output power limit of  not less
			 than 1 watt; and
do not require unlicensed devices to employ Dynamic Frequency Selection.

text.#text: The

header.#text: Assessing unlicensed spectrum and wi-fi use in low-income neighborhoods

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a study to evaluate the availability of broadband Internet access
			 using
			 unlicensed spectrum and wireless networks in low income neighborhoods.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
shall consider and evaluate—

any barriers preventing or limiting the deployment and use of wireless networks in low-income
			 neighborhoods;

through incentives, policies, or
			 requirements

			 technologies in low-income neighborhoods to increase broadband adoption by
			 elementary and secondary school-age children in schools and at home
			 in these communities;

text.#text: how to overcome the barriers described in
